article_title: Senate Can’t Agree on Aid for Flint, Stalling Energy Bill
article_text:
WASHINGTON—A fight over how to respond to the crisis over the drinking water in Flint, Mich., halted progress in the Senate Thursday on a broad energy bill that represents one of the few chances this year for Congress to pass a bipartisan bill.

A Senate group made up mostly of Democrats blocked the energy bill from clearing a procedural hurdle in a 46-50 vote, falling well short of the 60 needed to move forward. Lawmakers said they...
